benchmark_details.name: SCIGYM
benchmark_details.overview: SCIGYM is a benchmark that assesses LLMsâ€™ iterative experiment design and analysis abilities in open-ended scientific discovery tasks using a dry lab setup.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate large language models' capabilities in conducting scientific experiments and analysis in a simulated biological context.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: Performance of models declines significantly with increasing system complexity.

data.source: 350 SBML models curated from BioModels database
data.annotation: Curated and filtered to remove unusable models

methods: Evaluation of LLMs through simulated experiments
methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the similarity between predicted and actual biological models.
methodology.interpretation: Lower STE and higher RMS/NTS indicate better performance in recovering the underlying biological mechanisms.
methodology.baseline_results: Performance comparisons were made against zero-shot prompting results of the models.
methodology.validation: Validated through experimental simulations and comprehensive performance metrics.
